Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Katz.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member Katz moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of March 10 and March 24, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member Brewer.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Brewer moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 10 , 2004 and March 24, 2004 be adopted and printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Perkins:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 2909-11 Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045443 TCM.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 2909-11 Broadway, Manhattan (20045443TCM)

Reports of Special Committees

Items.MatterName: Equal employment benefits to the employees of city contractors.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating April 25, 2004, as Yom Ha’Zikkaron, a day of remembrance for the Israeli soldiers killed in the struggle for Israeli Independence.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The Following Council Member formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Member Barron.
Items.MatterName: Commemorating April 25, 2004, as Yom Ha'Zikkaron

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating Yom Ha’Shoah, Holocaust Remembrance Day, on April 18, 2004
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating Yom Ha'Shoah, Holocaust Remembrance Day, on April 18, 2004.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating Yom Ha’Atzma’Ut, Israeli Independence Day, on April 26, 2004.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following Council Member formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Member Barron.
Items.MatterName: Commemorating Yom Ha'Atzma'Ut, Israeli Independence Day, on April 26, 2004.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon United States Attorney General John Ashcroft and the Department of Justice to reopen the case of Emmett Till, in light of the discovery of new information, for a complete and thorough investigation into his 1955 murder, and to move aggressively to indict the murderers of Emmett Till, and bring them to justice.
Items.MatterName: US Attorney General John Ashcroft and the Dep't of Justice to reopen the case of Emmett Till.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at 147 Nostrand Avenue (Block 1754, Lot 1) and 7 Vernon Avenue (Block 1754, Lot 86), Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 422 of the Real Property Tax Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 134).
Items.MatterName: LU 134 - Supportive Housing Program for the Elderly Robert Moore Senior Housing, 147 Nostrand Ave., 7 Vernon Ave, Brooklyn, CD#3.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing April 25, 2004 as “March for Women’s Lives Day,” in honor of the landmark 1973 United States Supreme Court decision of Roe. v. Wade, which established a woman’s constitutional right to decide when and if to have a child, and further supporting the March for Women’s Lives, an event demonstrating overwhelming support for a woman’s right to choose safe and legal abortion and birth control, and offering the Council’s full support in ensuring the protection of the right of women to control their reproductive health, lives and futures in an ever-increasingly hostile anti-choice environment.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following 7 Council Members formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Members Felder, Gallagher, Gennaro, Gentile, Lanza, Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: March for Women's Lives Day, April 25, 2004.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing April as Minority Cancer Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Minority Cancer Awareness Month, April

Items.Title: General Order Calendar

Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the City Council to declare its support for plaintiffs Deadria Farmer-Paellmann, Mary Lacey Madison, Andrea Carrington and all others similarly situated, in their efforts to seek restitution in a federal class action suit brought against the corporations that are alleged to have participated in and directly profited from the abhorrent institution of slavery.
Items.MatterName: Slavery, Restitution and Class Action Suit

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the appropriate city agency to make available on the city’s official website biographical information pertaining to all street name changes.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the appropriate city agency to make available on the city's official website biographical information pertaining to all street name changes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to permit former inmates to reunite with their families in Section 8 housing by establishing less restrictive admissions screening policies.
Items.MatterName: NYC Housing Authority to permit former inmates to reunite with their families in Section 8 housing by establishing less restrictive admissions screening policies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to ensure that people with convictions are not automatically barred from a wide range of jobs for which they may be qualified and for which they would not endanger the public.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to ensure that people with convictions are not automatically barred from a wide range of jobs for which they may be qualified and for which they would not endanger the public.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the Administrative Code of the City of New York in relation to concessions contracts on properties under the jurisdiction of the Department of Parks and Recreation.
Items.MatterName: Concessions contracts on properties under the jurisdiction of the Dep't of Parks and Recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of fees established under the New York city community right-to-know law.
Items.MatterName: Right-To-Know Law Fees

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the operation of one or more circulation devices that create a sound level in excess of the permitted decibel level.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting operation of one or more circulation devices that sound level is in excess of the permitted decibel level.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the city to assume responsibility for cleaning sidewalks that abut certain retaining walls.
Items.MatterName: City to assume responsibility for cleaning sidewalks that abut certain retaining walls.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the planting of drought-resistant trees and vegetation on city-owned property.
Items.MatterName: Planting of drought-resistant trees and vegetation on city-owned property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to low-flow sink and lavatory faucets.
Items.MatterName: Low-flow sink and lavatory faucets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the frequency of street litter basket collection.
Items.MatterName: Frequency of street litter basket collection.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the regulation of receptacles for removal of waste material.
Items.MatterName: Regulation of receptacles for removal of waste material.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to opting in to the State Neighbor Notification Law concerning the application of pesticides.
Items.MatterName: Opting in to the State Neighbor Notification Law concerning the application of pesticides.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reduction of pesticide use by city agencies.
Items.MatterName: Reduction of pesticide use by city agencies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Environmental Protection Agency to create a program for water-efficient products similar to the ENERGY STAR® program for energy-efficient products.
Items.MatterName: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency to create a program for water-efficient products similar to the ENERGY STAR(r) program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Environmental Protection Agency to establish a mandatory 90 percent plant-by-plant mercury emission reduction standard for coal-fired power plants by the year 2008 and withdraw its proposed Utility Mercury Reductions Rule.
Items.MatterName: US Environmental Protection Agency to establish a mandatory 90% plant-by-plant mercury emission reduction standard for coal-fired power plants by the year 2008.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to include instruction in environmental science at all appropriate grade levels of the New York City public school system.
Items.MatterName: NYC Department of Education to include instruction in environmental science at all appropriate grade levels of the New York City public school system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Council of the City of New York to request the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation to promptly approve the allocation and award of $70 million in Community Development Block Grant funds under its control to the Hudson River Park Trust for the purpose of constructing the section of Hudson River Park running from Houston Street on the north to Chambers Street on the south and to call on the Governor of the State of New York and the Mayor of the City of New York to support such allocation and award.
Items.MatterName: Allocation and award of $70 million in Community Development Block Grant funds to the Hudson River Park Trust.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the establishment of an independent police investigation and audit board.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of an independent police investigation and audit board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of maximum school zone speed limits.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of maximum school zone speed limits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation designed to bring transparency to the functioning of State Authorities, which under current law are too often able to operate in secrecy and without meaningful oversight and accountability to taxpayers and elected officials.
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation designed to bring transparency to the functioning of State Authorities

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the distribution and completion of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s Half-Fare Program Application for the Mentally Disabled.
Items.MatterName: Distribution and completion of the MTA's Half-Fare Program Application for the Mentally Disabled.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development to create and implement policies that provide greater transparency regarding the status of buildings whose Section 8 status is set to expire or which have been labeled “distressed” by the Department of Housing and Urban Development.
Items.MatterName: US Dep't of Housing and Urban Development to create and implement policies that provide greater transparency regarding the status of buildings whose Section 8 status is set to expire or which have been labeled "distressed".

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to approve, A.3297, in relation to protecting the occupancy of a dwelling unit by a tenant sought by a landlord for personal use.
Items.MatterName: Protecting the occupancy of a dwelling unit by a tenant sought by a landlord for personal use (A.3297).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to green building standards for certain capital projects.
Items.MatterName: Requirements for city-owned and city-funded green buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to prohibiting the disposal of certain weapons that cannot be personalized and in relation to prohibiting the possession of weapons that are not personalized.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the disposal of certain weapons that cannot be personalized.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to approve S.50, the Veterans Health Care Guarantee Act, and H.R. 2318, the Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act, which would institute a mandatory funding mechanism for the Department of Veterans Affairs health care system.
Items.MatterName: Approve S.50, the Veterans Health Care Guarantee Act, and H.R. 2318.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to reject the Governor’s proposed four percent surcharge on admission to sporting events and amusement parks.
Items.MatterName: Reject the Governor's proposed four percent surcharge on admission to sporting events and amusement parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the inspection, testing, cleaning and maintenance of fire alarm systems in public schools by certified, independent contractors.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the inspection, testing, cleaning and maintenance of fire alarm systems in public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 36th Anniversary of the death of Martin Luther King, Jr. on April 4, 2004.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 36th Anniversary of the death of Martin Luther King, Jr. on April 4, 2004.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation the replacement of trees removed during construction projects.
Items.MatterName: Replacement of trees removed during construction projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact legislation permitting reciprocal, direct-to-consumer wine shipment in and out of New York State.
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation permitting reciprocal, direct-to-consumer wine shipment in and out of NYS.

Items.Title: Resolution Supporting the Elimination of the Sunset Provisions of the Local Government Records Management Improvement Fund (LGRMIF) and the Cultural Education Fund (CEF).
Items.MatterName: Supporting the Elimination of the Sunset Provisions of the Local Government Records Management Improvement Fund (LGRMIF) and the Cultural Education Fund (CEF).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5305-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8701-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey title of certain property to Gus Jenkins”.
Items.MatterName: Reconvey title of certain property to Gus Jenkins (S.5305-A, A.8701-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3299-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5982-A, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments and providing for the repeal of such provisions of such law upon expiration thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of santitation departments (S.3299-A, A.5982-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3300-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5981-A, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain lung disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments in certain cities”.
Items.MatterName: Lung disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments (S.3300-A, A.5981-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3376-A, and Assembly Members Abbate and Cohen, A.5923-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto”.
Items.MatterName: Permitting certain New York city sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions  (S.3376-A, A.5923-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6189, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.9799, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of correction in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the department of correction  (S.6189, A.9799)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6445, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.10187, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payments by the correction officers’ variable supplements fund”.
Items.MatterName: Payments by the correction officers' variable supplements fund (S.6445, A.10187)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.3835-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.7194-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, the mandated physically taxing program and the incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program for certain employees”.
Items.MatterName: Application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, mandated physically taxing program, incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program (S.3835-A, A.7194-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.6263, and Assembly Member Gianaris, A.9897, “AN ACT to enact the “wireless facility siting act”; to establish a one hundred twenty day moratorium upon the construction of wireless facilities in cities having a population of one million or more; to amend the general municipal law, in relation to the placement, construction and modification of wireless services facilities in certain municipalities; to direct the department of health to study, evaluate and make recommendations on the health effects of radio frequency signals and microwave energy emitted by wireless communications service facilities and wireless communications devices; and providing for the repeal of certain provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Wireless facility siting act (S.6263, A.9897)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.8484, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to fines and penalties for handicapped parking violations in a city with a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Fines and penalties for handicapped parking violations (A.8484)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of thirteen applications for certification of eligibility to apply for New York State Wage Tax Credits under the Zone Equivalent Area provisions of the New York State Empire Zones Program.
Items.MatterName: NYS Wage Tax Credits under the Zone Equivalent Areas Provisions of the NYS Empire Zone Program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the District Attorney, the New York State Attorney General and the United States Department of Justice to launch a full scale independent investigation into the shooting death of Timothy Stansbury by an officer of the New York City Police Department.
Items.MatterName: Launch a full scale independent investigation into the shooting death of Timothy Stansbury by an officer of the NYPD.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the distribution of a public health insurance program options pamphlet to parents and guardians of public school students.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the distribution of a public health insurance program options pamphlet to parents and guardians of public school students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the fines for the offense of failing to yield the right of way to emergency vehicles en route to an emergency.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the fines for the offense of failing to yield the right of way to emergency vehicles en route to an emergency.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring identifying numbers on the roof of any school bus.
Items.MatterName: Requiring identifying numbers on the roof of any school bus.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Dilan, S.4973-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8397-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner George Black, or if he is deceased, to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from him or to their successors in interest, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within  which  application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1762, Lot No. 62 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: In rem, George Black, Brooklyn (S.4973-A, A.8397-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Madison/23rd/Flatiron/Chelsea business improvement district.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Madison/23rd/Flatiron/Chelsea Business Improvement District.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Madison/23rd/Flatiron/Chelsea Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Madison/23rd/Flatiron/Chelsea Business Improvement District.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating civil penalties and a private right of action for false or fraudulent claims.
Items.MatterName: Creating civil penalties and a private right of action for false or fraudulent claims.

Items.MinutesNote:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, May 5, 2004.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following announcements

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: L.U. 112 & Res No. 309.  See files for individual votes.
